dcterms:description: L+M-24 is designed to focus on three key benefits of natural language in molecule design: compositionality, functionality, and abstraction. It is divided into four categories with important applications in the small-molecule domain: Biomedical, Light and Electricity, Human Interaction and Organoleptics, and Agriculture and Industry.
dcterms:title: L+M-24

dcterms:description: Properties extracted from PubChem include molecule-specific descriptions such as odor, taste, and decomposition.
dcterms:title: PubChem

dcterms:description: Functional properties extracted from patent literature, capturing molecules from both patent and scientific literature.

dcterms:description: ChemFOnt is a chemical functional ontology resource that includes health effect relations, organoleptic effect relations, and role relations.
dcterms:title: ChemFOnt
